crc.c

00001 
00039 #include "crc.h"
00040 
00041 /*
00042  * The boot on AVR cpu is placed at the end of flash memory, but the avr
00043  * address memory by byte and the pointers are 16bits long, so we are able
00044  * to address 64Kbyte memory max. For this reason we can't read the crctab
00045  * from flash, because it is placed at the end of memory. This is true every
00046  * time we have an AVR cpu with more that 64Kbyte of flash. To fix this problem
00047  * we let the compiler copy the table in RAM at startup. Obviously this solution
00048  * is not efficent, but for now this is the only way.
00049  */
00050 #if CPU_HARVARD && !(defined(ARCH_BOOT) && (ARCH & ARCH_BOOT))
00051     #define CRC_TABLE const uint16_t PROGMEM crc16tab[256]
00052 #else
00053     #define CRC_TABLE const uint16_t crc16tab[256]
00054 #endif
00055

00093 
00094 uint16_t crc16(uint16_t crc, const void *buffer, size_t len)
00095 {
00096     const unsigned char *buf = (const unsigned char *)buffer;
00097     while(len--)
00098         crc = UPDCRC16(*buf++, crc);
00099 
00100     return crc;
00101 }
